image.altText: Katrina Munting wears a bright patterned shirt and stands near trees on an overcast day.

props.synopsis: Victim-survivor Katrina Munting says she remains hopeful, but she is concerned the government isn't implementing the commission of inquiry's recommendations quickly enough.

title.children: 'Was it worth it?': Two years on from Tasmania's child sexual abuse report

image.altText: Roslyn Grima sits in the sun outside her home. A dachshund lays at her feet.

props.synopsis: A court has granted Roslyn Grima the right to list her caravan park home on the market, but whether she can legally make a sale remains in dispute.

title.children: Caravan park resident with months to live can list her home for sale, court rules

image.altText: The front foor of Calvary St Luke's Hospital in Launceston.

props.synopsis: The shutdown of Calvary St Luke's Hospital will affect 40 planned surgeries this week, with 22 of those reallocated to nearby St Vincent's Hospital.

title.children: Surgeries suspended after tears found in Launceston operating theatre floor

image.altText: Mountain and houses

props.synopsis: Have you switched your Tasmanian investment property from short-stay accommodation into a long-term rental? We want to hear from you.

title.children: Have you turned short-stay accommodation into a long-term rental? Let us know

image.altText: Cradle mountain under light snow at sunrise with Dove Lake showing it reflected in the foreground.

props.synopsis: Cradle Mountain is one of Tasmania's most popular, and dangerous, tourism destinations. After another tragedy, questions are asked about what more could be done to ensure the safety of visitors.

title.children: Death at top Tassie tourist site prompts questions on what more can be done

image.altText: Big red ship docked in water

props.synopsis: The new Bass Strait ferries have both been completed but new works are needed after an issue with the vessels' hull specifications was detected.

title.children: Completed Spirit of Tasmania vessels now need hulls modified

image.altText: Kangaroo Bay Plan

props.synopsis: Clarence Mayor Brendan Blomeley says the council will "engage with the community" about what should go there instead of Chambroad's contentious boutique hotel development.

title.children: Clarence City Council 'remains committed' to buying back Chambroad's Kangaroo Bay land

image.altText: Aerial shot of dozens of houses in neat rows in a new outer-suburban housing estate.

props.synopsis: Home values have gained for the eighth month in a row. Experts warn that a rush of first home buyers signing up to the Home Guarantee Scheme will only fuel price growth.

title.children: Eight-month streak of rising home prices shows no sign of ending

image.altText: A close up of a middle aged woman with a worried expression, looking up and to her left.

props.synopsis: With Hamas yet to provide its response to Donald Trump's peace plan, affected civilians on both sides of the war share their concerns and hopes for the future.

title.children: Israeli hostage families and Palestinians in nervous wait over Gaza peace plan

image.altText: A close-up of Anthony Albanese.

props.synopsis: This year's Boyer Lectures will consider whether our democratic system will hold in the face of global headwinds.

title.children: Will Australia's democracy survive global collapse?

image.altText: A surfer balancing on a board on a wave.

props.synopsis: The disastrous algal bloom that has been, for at least six months, lapping at South Australia's shores has turned a coastline into a frontline, and has left many swimmers, surfers and seaside business operators wondering what the upcoming summer will look like.

title.children: The sea is sick and has entered uncharted waters

image.altText: Keith Urban and Nicole Kidman on the red carpet prior to the Oscars ceremony.

props.synopsis: The Oscar-winning actor files for divorce in a Nashville court a day after reports emerged of the couple's separation, with a source saying the decision to leave was Keith Urban's.

title.children: Nicole Kidman files for divorce, says marriage 'suffered irreconcilable differences'

image.altText: Pete Hegseth

props.synopsis: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth summoned hundreds of US military officials to an in-person meeting to declare an end to "woke" culture in the military.

title.children: Hegseth slams 'fat generals' and diversity initiatives in US military

image.altText: an illustration showing a young person sitting against a wall on a skateboard, with court symbols

props.synopsis: The ABC spent a week inside the court that presides over youth crime and witnessed fearful victims, young people living with trauma and magistrates facing the difficult to decision to bail or remand.

title.children: 'I'm at my wit's end': A week inside a children's court

image.altText: Jeff Schoep sitting in Chesterfield chair.

props.synopsis: Former US Neo-Nazi leader Jeff Schoep urges the Australian media not to publicise the actions of Neo-Nazis, after attending protests to gain insights into extremism in Victoria.

title.children: American ex-Neo-Nazi condemns rise in extremism in Victoria

image.altText: A human egg before fertilisation.

props.synopsis: Scientists have used human skin cells to produce functional eggs using a new scientific technique they say could one day help infertile people have their own biological children.

title.children: Human eggs produced from skin cells in scientific first

image.altText: The terrain near Yunta.

props.synopsis: Police are continuing to search for Gus, who vanished while playing at his family's homestead near Yunta in a remote part of South Australia's north.

title.children: Search for four-year-old boy in SA's outback enters fifth day

image.altText: A young boy in a black had gives the peace sign in a close-up selfie with his dad, a man with grey facial hair.

props.synopsis: Melbourne researchers test a new AI tool that detects tiny lesions in children with epilepsy, leading to surgeries that leave them seizure-free.

title.children: 'Like a dream': AI tool helps children with epilepsy live seizure-free

image.altText: A man wearing glasses and a brown shirt.

props.synopsis: The Riyadh Comedy Festival stars A-list comedians like Peter Davidson, but despite its blockbuster acts, it has copped backlash for what one human rights organisation says is a "whitewashing" of a "brutal repression of free speech".

title.children: Why stars are 'disgusted' at those performing at a Saudi comedy festival

image.altText: Afghan girls attend a religious studies class dressed in traditional black robes.

props.synopsis: Internet and mobile services have been cut across the country, a move human rights groups say will severely impact women and girls in particular.

title.children: Women and girls severely impacted by telecom blackout in Afghanistan

image.altText: A man in a cap and glasses.

props.synopsis: The devastated family of a missing four-year-old boy has released a statement saying it is holding on to hope "he will be found and returned safely" as authorities and community members continue the search in mid-north South Australia.

title.children: 'Our hearts are aching': Missing boy's family releases statement as search continues

image.altText: Men holding "SCRAP THE PLAN" signs.

props.synopsis: The controversial housing plan that would see 31,000 apartments built in the inner west was passed by one vote on Tuesday night.

title.children: Councillors booed, cheered after plan for 31,000 new Sydney homes passes

image.altText: A person works on his computer at a workstation.

props.synopsis: The economic contribution of start-ups has been overlooked, as a new study suggests age and performance should be taken into consideration when it comes to incentive policy.

title.children: When it comes to business, size does matter — and smaller may perform better

image.altText: Man with white hair, in blue suit, waving hat

props.synopsis: Disgraced former MP Gareth Ward was paid a weekly salary of more than $3,000 while waiting to be sentenced for sexual offences. An Illawarra resident wants to ensure that never happens again.

title.children: Voter launches petition to stop convicted MPs being paid in jail

image.altText: Red rock with various animals etched in including camels and goats, highlighted with blue tracing.

props.synopsis: Three newly discovered sites filled with art and stone tools have pushed back the date on when humans returned to Arabia after the last ice age.

title.children: Camel carvings reveal humans inhabited Arabian desert 12,000 years ago

image.altText: A woman looks at the myTax website on a computer screen, resting her head on her hand.

props.synopsis: The 2024/25 tax deadline is fast approaching, and missing the cut-off date could end up costing you. Here's what you need to know.

title.children: Haven't done your tax return yet? You have one month left

image.altText: Signs promoting the CFMEU in front of Parliament House in Brisbane

props.synopsis: The inquiry will look at claims of misconduct connected to the Queensland branch of the CFMEU and the effect on the state's construction industry, major projects and productivity.

title.children: The Qld inquiry into the CFMEU is underway. Here's what it is about

image.altText: A group of rugby league players stand together during the national anthem

props.synopsis: Only three men have steered Brisbane to a premiership, and Shane Perry is the only one who has done it while working a full-time job and playing without a contract.

title.children: 'Couldn't get rid of me': The inside story of Brisbane's unlikeliest premiership hero

image.altText: A man wearing a suit smiles aas he cuts a white ribbon standing in front of a flag and sign showing the opening of an office

props.synopsis: On a visit to New Zealand in July, FBI Director Kash Patel presented three senior security officials with 3D-printed guns that were later destroyed.

title.children: FBI boss Patel gave NZ officials 3D-printed guns on Wellington visit

image.altText: Water with black swirls and clouds floating between two poles.

props.synopsis: Building company Boral works to clean up thousands of litres of kerosene and bitumen from one of its plants that have spilled into a creek in Cairns, connecting to an inlet that leads to the Great Barrier Reef.

title.children: Clean-up underway after 'devastating' industrial spill in Far North Queensland

image.altText: Sean 'Diddy' Combs

props.synopsis: New York prosecutors cite one of Sean "Diddy" Combs accusers who says she lives in fear of his release from detention as the music mogul's case returns to court for sentencing.

title.children: Prosecutors seek over 11 years in prison for Sean 'Diddy' Combs

image.altText: Bailey Smith and Harris Andrews clash in the AFL grand final.

props.synopsis: Geelong forged years of goodwill via its accessibility to Mad Monday — now the club faces a mess that it never saw coming.

title.children: Two Instagram posts unravelled years of goodwill at Geelong's Mad Monday

image.altText: A headshot of Lorde wearing a white t shirt in a studio setting.

props.synopsis: When Charli xcx released a song about her on the era-defining album Brat, Lorde didn't expect it to drag her onto a path that would redefine her trajectory.

title.children: 'It still destroys me': How Lorde's collaboration with Charli xcx changed her course
